questions.question: What is the primary function of a flip-flop in digital circuits?
options: To perform arithmetic and logical operations
To amplify weak electrical signals
To store a single bit of binary data
To convert analog signals to digital
To regulate power supply voltage

questions.question: In the physical design flow of a digital integrated circuit, what is the primary objective of Static Timing Analysis (STA)?
options: To automatically route interconnections between placed cells
To verify that all layout features adhere to manufacturing rules (DRC)
To ensure that the circuit meets all specified timing constraints (e.g., clock frequency, setup/hold times)
To place standard cells and macros onto the chip's die area
To estimate the parasitic capacitance and resistance of interconnects

questions.question: Which advanced lithography technique primarily uses light with a wavelength of 13.5 nm, necessitating a vacuum environment and reflective optics, to enable the patterning of smaller features in semiconductor manufacturing?
options: Immersion Lithography
Electron Beam Lithography
X-ray Lithography
Extreme Ultraviolet (EUV) Lithography
Deep Ultraviolet (DUV) Lithography

questions.question: In computer architecture, what is the primary purpose of a Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB)?
options: To cache frequently accessed data blocks from main memory for faster CPU access
To provide a fast lookup mechanism for virtual-to-physical address translations
To reorder instructions to enable out-of-order execution in the pipeline
To store microcode sequences for complex instructions to simplify hardware design
To maintain coherence among multiple CPU caches in a multiprocessor system

questions.question: What is the fundamental concept behind pipelining in processor design?
options: Executing multiple instructions simultaneously by using multiple processing units in parallel
Storing frequently used data closer to the CPU to reduce memory access latency
Breaking down the execution of an instruction into a series of sequential stages that operate concurrently on different instructions
Running multiple independent programs or threads at the same time on a single core
Adjusting the processor's clock frequency and voltage dynamically to reduce power consumption
